definitions.definition: the action of writing one's signature on an official document.
examples: he plans to oversee the signing of modest agreements on energy, education, and the environment

definitions.definition: the action of recruiting someone, especially to a professional sports team or record company.
a person who has recently been recruited, especially to join a professional sports team or record company.
an event in a bookstore or other place at which an author signs a number of books to gain publicity and sales.
the provision of signs in a street or other place.
write one's name on (a letter, card, or similar item) to identify oneself as the writer or sender.
examples: the card was signed by the whole class

definitions.definition: indicate agreement with or authorization of the contents of (a document or other written or printed material) by attaching a signature.
examples: the two countries signed a nonaggression treaty
synonyms: give one's approval to; informalgive something the go-ahead
give something the thumbs up "the government signed the agreement"

definitions.definition: write (one's name) for purposes of identification or authorization.
examples: she signed her name in the book

definitions.definition: engage (someone, typically a sports player or a musician) to work for one by signing a contract with them.
synonyms: enlist "we have signed a new player"

definitions.definition: sign a contract committing oneself to work for a particular person or organization.
examples: Sherman has signed for another two seasons

definitions.definition: use gestures to convey information or instructions.
examples: she signed to her husband to leave the room

definitions.definition: express or perform (something) in sign language.
examples: the theater routinely puts on signed performances

definitions.definition: mark or consecrate with the sign of the cross.
